intro: Grossularia nivea, commonly known as the snow grape, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saxifragaceae. It is native to the alpine regions of Central Asia, including parts of the Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, round berries that are typically red or black when mature. This plant is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
